Message.Title: Who will be "Tax Gates" Deep Throat?
Message.Msg: Larry had an exUS Attorney for the IRS on last night who explained perfectly why it probably is that the Mittanic does not want to release those taxes further back than 2010. In 2009, the government gave all people with undeclared money in offshore accounts a one time amnesty for revealing those accounts. In order to get that amnesty they had to go back to 2003 and amend all of Read More... those years tax returns, and declare that money and pay taxes and penalties and interest on those accounts. It was and still is a felony to have offshore accounts that you do not reveal to the IRS and pay taxes on that money. If he had those offshore accounts all those years and had never declared them, that meant he was committing a felony, and his tax returns from 2003 to 2009 would show that they had been amended and interest and penalties paid for not declaring that money until forced to in 2009. So it appears that the Mittanic may be more afraid for it to be known that he was a felon, than for us to know that he used crafty tax laws to pay no taxes.

Message.Title: they love Mitt in Iowa
Message.Msg: love him like a hedge post, lol “When he does come to Iowa and puts on a pair of blue jeans and flannel shirt, the poor guy looks as stiff as a hedge post.” One of his sons, Kurt, 23, said he might choose a third-party candidate. He disliked Mr. Romney’s “liberal past” when he favored abortion rights and signed an assault weapons ban as Massachusetts governor, positions Mr. Romney repudiated long ago. “I don’t see a major change unless it’s convenient for him,” Kurt Boender said. His sister, Becky Boender Ochsner, 29, who is married to a pastor, said that despite Mr. Romney and Mr. Obama’s vast differences on most issues, she saw little to distinguish them. It is “an East Coast person’s” view that a candidate is the sum of his policy positions, she said. “I think there’s more to a person and their leadership abilities, such as character,” she said. “Romney and Obama are both very arrogant and represent the political class. I think they would make similar decisions on the same things.”
